Just got my learners, going to buy the bike to learn riding. CBR500R vs Ninja 400 which one is better ?

quote.msg: Just got my learners, going to buy the bike to learn riding. CBR500R vs Ninja 400 which one is better ?

replies.msg: if i were you i would go for a street bike instead of a sport bike

quote.msg: Just got my learners, going to buy the bike to learn riding. CBR500R vs Ninja 400 which one is better ?

replies.msg:
Get a smaller bike (say 125-300cc) if you're in HK (I'd even suggest you not to buy any when you're still a learner).
If you're in the States, just pick the one you like best. So much easier to get a license there.

Imo, ninja400 is better. Technically it's lighter in weight and has a smaller displacement which make it a better starting bike. In addition, it looks cooler than the Honda.

Thanks mate, you can tell I am not in HK for sure. As a person who walked into a BMW Motorrad dealership yesterday, it’s was kind of embarrassing simply asking for small displacement bikes.

Personally, I am ok with the Ninja, wouldn’t it would be a bit small for a 5”10 , average size man?


As a gesture, here are some snaps from the dealership on the other day

You shouldn't be embarrassed by looking at smaller bikes. A bigger bike doesn't mean it's better. Although bigger bikes tend to have fancier technologies and parts, afterall it all depends on your need.

If you commute on the highway for a long distance a lot, then a bigger bike has advantages coz you can cruise her at high speed.
On the other hand, if you just need her for short rides in the city, then a small bike has the upper hand coz you don't need much speed, and it's lighter and fuel efficient.

The ninja is perfectly fine for your size. However, bikes come with different design and gives different riding posture. Some has lower seats and higher bars, vice versa... E.g. a sportbike has a more aggresive riding posture than a streetbike, that may not be comfortable for you to ride. Just go to a dealer and actually sit on the bikes and see how you feel.
